contentrichtext.text: The '''Louisiana State University System''' is budgetarily the largest public university system in [[Louisiana]]. William L. Jenkins is the system's interim president.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lombardi fired with 12-4 vote on Friday, Jenkins to take over as interim|url=http://www.lsureveille.com/news/lombardi-fired-with-12-4-vote-on-friday-1.2737305#.T56td47NAQQ|publisher=The Daily Reveille|accessdate=30 April 2012}}</ref> The system has its headquarters in the System Building on the property of [[Louisiana State University]] in [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana|Baton Rouge]]â€”3810 West Lakeshore Drive.<ref>"[http://www.lsusystem.edu/index.php/faculty-staff/ Staff Directory]." Louisiana State University System. Retrieved on August 31, 2011. "3810 W. Lakeshore Dr. Rm. 107 Baton Rouge, LA 70808"</ref><ref>"[http://appl037.lsu.edu/dir/dirdept.nsf/DeptView/1862?OpenDocument Offices of the LSU System]." Louisiana State University System. Retrieved on August 31, 2011. "Offices of the LSU System 3810 W. Lakeshore Drive Baton Rouge, Louisiana 70808"</ref><ref>"[http://www.lsu.edu/campus/locations/SYST.html System Building]." [[Louisiana State University]]. Retrieved on August 31, 2011.</ref><ref>"[http://www.lsu.edu/campus/maps/SYST01.html Interactive Campus Map > System Building]." [[Louisiana State University]]. Retrieved on August 31, 2011. [http://www.lsu.edu/campus/images-map/SYST01.gif Image 1] [http://www.lsu.edu/campus/images-map/SYST02.gif Image 2]</ref> [[File:LSU System logo.tif|thumb|LSU system logo]] == Current LSU System entities == === Institutions === * [[Louisiana State University|Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College]] (main campus in [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana|Baton Rouge]]) * [[Louisiana State University Agricultural Center]] - Baton Rouge (established 1972) * [[Pennington Biomedical Research Center]] in Baton Rouge * [[Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center New Orleans]] (established in 1931). * [[Louisiana State University at Alexandria]] (opened 1960) * [[Louisiana State University at Eunice]] (opened 1967) * [[Louisiana State University in Shreveport]] (opened 1967) * [[Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center Shreveport]] (classes began 1969). * [[Paul M. Hebert Law Center]] - Baton Rouge (became separate institution in 1977) === LSU Health (Public Hospital System) === * [[Bogalusa Medical Center]], [[Bogalusa, Louisiana|Bogalusa]]. * [[Doctor Walter O. Moss Regional Medical Center]], [[Lake Charles, Louisiana|Lake Charles]]. * [[Earl K. Long Medical Center]], [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana|Baton Rouge]]. * [[Huey P. Long Medical Center]], [[Pineville, Louisiana|Pineville]]. * [[Lallie Kemp Regional Medical Center]], [[Independence, Louisiana|Independence]]. * [[Leonard J. Chabert Medical Center]], [[Houma, Louisiana|Houma]]. * [[Medical Center of Louisiana at New Orleans|Medical Center of Louisiana at New Orleans (MCLNO)]], [[New Orleans, Louisiana|New Orleans]]. ** [[Charity Hospital (New Orleans)|Charity Hospital]] (1736), New Orleans. ** [[University Hospital, New Orleans|University Hospital]], New Orleans. * [[University Medical Center, Lafayette|University Medical Center]], [[Lafayette, Louisiana|Lafayette]]. The LSU system has a presence in all 64 Louisiana parishes through its cooperative extension service. This service assists farmers, gardeners, and other businesses in dealing with some of Louisiana's unique environmental challenges. == Current LSU System board members <ref>{{cite web|title=LSU System Board of Supervisors|url=http://www.lsusystem.edu/index.php/board-of-supervisors/board-members/|accessdate=13 July 2012}}</ref> == * Garret Danos (Chairman) * Robert Yarborough (Chairman-Elect / Member-at-large) * James W. Moore, Jr. (Past chairman) * Scott Ballard (District 1) * Stanley J. Jacobs (District 1) * Ann Duplessis (District 2) * J. Stephen Perry (District 2) * Garret Danos (District 3) * Anthony G. Falterman (District 3) * John George (District 4) * Raymond J. Lasseigne (District 4) * R. Blake Chatelain (District 5) * James W. Moore, Jr. (District 5) * Ronald R. Anderson (District 6) * Rolfe H. McCollister, Jr. (District 6) * Jack E. Lawton, Jr. (District 7) * Lee Mallett (District 7) ==See also== {{Portal|Louisiana|University}} * [[List of colleges and universities in Louisiana]] * [[List of hospitals in Louisiana]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.lsusystem.edu/ LSU System Web Site] * [http://www.lsuhospitals.org/ LSU Health Care Services Division] {{LSU}} {{University Systems in Louisiana}} [[Category:Universities and colleges in Louisiana]] [[Category:Louisiana State University System]] [[Category:Public university systems in the United States]] [[Category:Association of Public and Land-Grant Universities]]
